ORSF summary of univariate information

Source: R/orsf_summary.R
orsf_summarize_uni.Rd

ORSF's linear combinations of inputs can be used to provide helpful data about individual variables. Summarizing the univariate information from an ORSF provides data on the importance of individual variables and the expected predicted risk at designated values of the variables.

orsf_summarize_uni(object, n_variables = NULL, times = NULL, risk = TRUE)

Arguments

object

(aorsf) an oblique random survival forest (ORSF; see orsf).

n_variables

(integer) how many variables should be summarized? Setting this input to a lower number will improve computation time.

times

(double) a single time or a vector of times for oblique RSF predictions. All times values must not exceed the maximum follow-up time in the oblique RSF's training data. Also, times must be entered in ascending order.

risk

(logical) if TRUE, predicted risk is returned. If FALSE, predicted survival (i.e., 1-risk) is returned.

Value

an object of class 'aorsf_summary'

Examples


object <- orsf(pbc_orsf, Surv(time, status) ~ . - id)

orsf_summarize_uni(object, n_variables = 3)
#> 
#> -- age (VI Rank: 1) ----------------------------
#> 
#>        |---------------- risk ----------------|
#>  Value      Mean    Median     25th %    75th %
#>     42 0.2692738 0.1310593 0.04487348 0.4533908
#>     50 0.2955560 0.1612268 0.05282062 0.5021296
#>     57 0.3274544 0.2134869 0.07334726 0.5502459
#> 
#> -- bili (VI Rank: 2) ---------------------------
#> 
#>        |---------------- risk ----------------|
#>  Value      Mean    Median     25th %    75th %
#>   0.80 0.2270731 0.1187680 0.04273851 0.3463064
#>    1.4 0.2468112 0.1342106 0.05653561 0.3692547
#>    3.5 0.3664174 0.2898311 0.16443210 0.5355515
#> 
#> -- protime (VI Rank: 3) ------------------------
#> 
#>        |---------------- risk ----------------|
#>  Value      Mean    Median     25th %    75th %
#>     10 0.2776875 0.1470030 0.05001428 0.4885425
#>     11 0.2894622 0.1574799 0.05646105 0.5114524
#>     11 0.3109973 0.1782717 0.07217008 0.5324219
#> 
#>  Predicted risk at time t = 1788 for top 3 predictors
